article_title: The N64's most infamous JRPG is getting the same recompilation treatment that gave us 60 FPS PC remasters of Super Mario 64 and Zelda: Ocarina of Time
core_topic: A fan-created recompilation project for the Nintendo 64 game Quest 64, enabling a PC version with modern features like 60 FPS.

alternatives.title: Quest 64 Recompiled: The "classic" RPG like you've never seen it before - Read Only Memo
alternatives.reason: This article is explicitly cited by the original news article as the source of its report. It details the recompilation project's progress and features, effectively acting as the first public journalistic report on the subject.

reasoning_summary: The original news article states that the Quest 64 recompilation project was 'reported by Read Only Memo.' While the Read Only Memo article serves as the immediate journalistic source, the GitHub repository for 'Rainchus/Quest64-Recomp' is identified as the official project repository where the recompilation's code, features, and release information originate. This repository represents the most direct primary source for the underlying software artifact and its development details. The Read Only Memo article itself indicates that it is reporting on a 'new build' that was already out, implying the project's existence and progress predate the article.

article_title: Ghosts'n Goblins is also getting a Commodore Amiga AGA edition via JOTD!
reasoning_summary: The article quotes the developer JOTD directly about starting work on a Ghosts'n Goblins Amiga AGA edition, including the specific phrasing 'This will be a AGA-only project I think. The original OCS version by Elite is already very good. Not sure it can be improved (apart from the reuse of the original code)'. Multiple search results, including other news aggregators, point to a post by 'jotd' on the English Amiga Board (EAB) forum as the origin of this statement. The EAB thread from December 31, 2025, contains the exact quotes and context, confirming it as the primary announcement from the developer.

core_topic: Retirement of veteran Nintendo producer Kensuke Tanabe.

primary_source.title: ニンテンドードリーム 26年3月号：付録は『あつまれ どうぶつの森 Nintendo Switch 2 Edition』ガイドブック＆『Pokémon LEGENDS Z-A』ロ〜ングポスター

alternatives.title: Nintendo DREAM 2026年3月号 | dマガジンなら人気雑誌が読み放題！
alternatives.reason: Digital subscription service page for the magazine issue, potentially containing the full interview, but behind a paywall.

reasoning_summary: The article states that the information originates from an interview with Kensuke Tanabe in the Japanese magazine 'Nintendo Dream', specifically the March 2026 issue, which was reportedly uploaded by a user on Weibo. The most authoritative primary source available on an official domain is the official Nintendo Dream website's page for the March 2026 issue. This page confirms the issue's publication date (January 21, 2026) and lists an interview related to 'Metroid Prime 4 Beyond' within its contents, aligning with the news reports. While the full interview text is not freely accessible on this page, it is the official announcement from the magazine publisher itself. An alternative is a digital subscription service page for the same issue, which would contain the full interview but is behind a paywall. The Weibo post is difficult to verify as the original upload and would be a less authoritative source than the publisher's official statement.
